triples.name: Microplastics
triples.relevance: The paper studies the effects of microplastic diversity on microbial communities, making microplastics the central focus.

triples.name: Biodiversity
triples.relevance: Microplastic diversity is examined as a driver of biodiversity effects on microbial network complexity and stability.

triples.name: Microbial consortium
triples.relevance: The paper studies microbial communities in lake sediments under different microplastic exposure conditions.

triples.name: Ecological network
triples.relevance: Ecological network analysis is the primary analytical framework used to examine microbial community structure and stability.

triples.name: Microcosm (experimental ecosystem)
triples.relevance: The study uses 600 microcosms as the experimental system to examine microbial communities under controlled conditions.

triples.name: Biological interaction
triples.relevance: Species interactions are analyzed as a key mechanism through which microplastic diversity affects network structure and stability.

triples.name: Network complexity
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and demonstrates that microplastic diversity enhances network complexity as measured by connectance and path length.

triples.name: Ecological stability
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates that higher microplastic diversity and temperature lead to more robust and stable microbial networks.
